C29586B9BAC94668B0825212DE1B27A7.description: Use grade appropriate general academic and domain-specific vocabulary accurately within writing.

40B75F3DD2014573BA850721A93A16FF.description: Use general academic and domain specific words and phrases accurately.

0B40E673D4B041C79D92AB6C21D2B32B.description:
Acquire and accurately use grade-appropriate general academic and domain-specific words and phrases, including those that signal precise
actions, emotions, or states of being (e.g., quizzed, whined, stammered) and that are basic to a particular topic (e.g., wildlife, conservation, and
endangered when discussing animal preservation).

F047605643C14FD0B61477527DBBFCB0.description: Identify the meaning of common idioms.

0EF7D3274C514F65AEE612910E31260C.description: Relate words to words with similar but not identical meanings (synonyms).

ED7FAD1BD1DD4C7CA84E8B2DB10BA700.description:
Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and nuances in word meanings.
a. Explain the meaning of simple similes and metaphors (e.g., as pretty as a picture) in context.
b. Recognize and explain the meaning of common idioms, adages, and proverbs.
c. Demonstrate understanding of words by relating them to their synonyms and antonyms.

CA15F1D061D14C12B9421C3A0C4F135E.description: Determine the meaning of literal and nonliteral words and phrases as they are used in a text.

A5B1576BA97E4EB4802D70FF183087AD.description: Use a glossary, dictionary, or thesaurus to determine the meaning of a word.

9EDC862712F544A89B16AD0F3E09EEBD.description: Use common grade-appropriate roots and affixes as clues to the meaning of a word.

A4BDA12D8EEB4480BB9A121793224000.description: Use context to determine the meaning of unknown or multiple meaning words, or words showing shades of meaning.

C64C753D506D474DB167ADF2E14CA2AD.description:
Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on grade 4 reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of strategies.
a. Use common, grade-appropriate Greek and Latin affixes and roots as clues to the meaning of a word (e.g., telegraph, photograph,
autograph).
b. Use context (e.g., definitions, examples, or restatements in text) as a clue to the meaning of a word or phrase.
c. Consult reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri), both print and digital, to find the pronunciation and determine or clarify
the precise meaning of key words and phrases.

FE08D2B6E06340C8A963518740D46313.description: Choose words and phrases for appropriate effect (e.g., to inform) within writing.

E1335AAFE69644138DCE6AB684DB78AE.description:
Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.
a. Choose words and phrases to convey ideas precisely.
b. Choose punctuation for effect.
c. Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate
(e.g., small-group discussion).

94192142DB274CE89E2639C95D0FA10E.description: Spell words correctly in writing, consulting references as needed.

9D20BF5241BE4CCB8645475FAB621B64.description: Use commas and quotation marks in writing.

F9D40A27F57841F591A5DC839E827B09.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when writing.
a. Use correct capitalization.
b. Use commas and quotation marks to mark direct speech and quotations from a text.
c. Use a comma before a coordinating conjunction in a compound sentence.
d. Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

B15F62F30FB44B66BC9603CEE2D9903D.description: Recognize and correct inappropriate fragments and run-on sentences.

0D54F932F63340E1A4456032EEDA7055.description: Produce simple, compound, and complex sentences in writing.

028B750620FB4203AC170DD15D21D589.description: Use relative pronouns and relative adverbs in writing.

3D0203C9701A4D62816E8DA7FFFAF283.description:
Demonstrate command of the conventions of Standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking.
a. Use relative pronouns (who, whose, whom, which, that) and relative adverbs (where, when, why).
b. Form and use the progressive verb tenses (e.g., I was walking; I am walking; I will be walking).
c. Use modal auxiliaries (e.g., can, may, must) to convey various conditions.
d. Order adjectives within sentences according to conventional patterns (e.g., a small red bag rather than a red small bag).
e. Form and use prepositional phrases.
f. Produce complete sentences, recognizing and correcting inappropriate fragments and run-ons.
g. Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to, too, two; there, their).
h. Write and organize one or more paragraphs that contain: a topic sentence, supporting details, and a conclusion that is appropriate to the
writing task. (Construction of paragraph(s) should demonstrate command of Writing standards 1-3.)

2A05DB82AFAE4D0FBC66993B053A47D8.description: No CCCs written for this standard.

1324F3CA89BD4A86A4B221542D4993B6.description:
Differentiate between contexts that call for formal English (e.g., presenting ideas) and situations where informal discourse is appropriate (e.g.,
small-group discussion); use formal English when appropriate to task and situation. (See grade 4 Language standards 1 and 3 for specific
expectations).

3CAAA592A44E40E5B9F1B776BF668220.description:
Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or
themes.

F8737BF114E74F469E830C32BBE54C0F.description: Add audio recordings and visual displays to presentations when appropriate to enhance the development of main ideas or themes.

826A40393EA04E6082B9891DD0CB74FA.description:
Report on a topic, story or claim using a logical sequence of ideas, appropriate facts, and relevant and descriptive details
4.WP.m3 Elaborate on each fact or opinion given in support of a claim with relevant details.

730FF0FE33174A4D821F0D60124C592C.description:
Report on a topic or text, tell a story, or recount an experience in an organized manner, using appropriate facts and relevant, descriptive
details to support main ideas or themes; speak clearly at an understandable pace.

C0AE5802AE9A45DBA0013AE82797471B.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

905D7C3106DA48B98526DE3439D9AEEC.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

DDEB208DFD8347AE99E34189A2373819.description: Identify the reasons and evidence a speaker provides to support particular points.

955D26373D8B4FF381F7C65B6972ABBD.description:
Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively, and orally.

DA533CA64B9C475BB33E9A89EB78914E.description:
Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually,
quantitatively, and orally.

5D21F1A5F9C9452BA47B5B2193C52AC6.description: Paraphrase portions of a text read aloud or information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively, and orally.

D0B89C1059084293946EEBAE524C7A6C.description: Review the key ideas expressed within a collaborative discussion.

1B7BF7AAAE3D46E19F1B19439C7D8FFE.description: Make appropriate comments that contribute to a collaborative discussion.

575E5A9354A04026BB466AFCA4AC2A08.description: Ask questions to check understanding of information presented in collaborative discussions.

6CE434F1EDDE47F09EA5C8A8E2978A9E.description:
Provide evidence of being prepared for discussions on a topic or text through appropriate statements made during
discussion.

292F14CCC8E94E2EA5FDACBFA04D19BD.description:
Engage effectively in a range of collaborative discussions (one-on-one, in groups, and teacher-led) with diverse partners on grade 4 topics and
texts, building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly.
a. Come to discussions prepared having read or studied required material; explicitly draw on that preparation and other information known
about the topic to explore ideas under discussion.
b. Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions and carry out assigned roles.
c. Pose and respond to specific questions to clarify or follow up on information, and make comments that contribute to the discussion and link
to the remarks of others.
d. Review the key ideas expressed and explain their own ideas and understanding based on the discussion.

6639D9CE7DA846C0A60E4EA69C5C4448.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

251BABE992E64378B1D8903D02F01725.description:
Demonstrate and apply handwriting skills.
a. Read and write cursive letters, upper and lower case.
b. Transcribe ideas legibly and fluently with appropriate spacing and indentation.

87B3301873E44258AF0C668795EC87B6.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

A023BFB67ADF49F78BE07D4667B77343.description:
Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two)
for a range of discipline-specific tasks, purposes, and audiences.

7B5DF86C471542169B5C5D5B9A0C4E23.description:
Analyze mentor texts to support knowledge of persuasive writing (e.g., analyze newspaper editorials to explore the way the
author developed the argument).

9E8DB20ED61047618917AFB8291C6B94.description:
Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.
a. Apply grade 4 Reading standards to literature.
b. Apply grade 4 Reading standards to informational texts.

C38CA3DA344B40C7B6DC658763266A82.description: Take brief notes and categorize information(e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) from sources.

E5AF775532A846A491443F70AE016AF8.description: Provide a list of sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

93AE7A70543A4541A836EB31ECFCDEE4.description: Provide a list of sources that contributed to the content within a writing piece.

BCE131930FDB4DA7A0E9CDC81AD8183F.description: Sort evidence collected from print and/or digital sources into provided categories.

A7CA355BFC054A9BBF41070F6551401C.description: Take brief notes and categorize information (e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) from sources.

8431B4F760CF448C9DAFEC19D971C97D.description: Take brief notes and categorize information (e.g., graphic organizers, notes, labeling, listing) from sources.

2226368E2613437A9641A12A30B892A8.description: Identify key details from an informational text.

64F8268C428F435FA7AF432BAED6121A.description: Gather information (e.g., highlight, quote, or paraphrase from source) relevant to the topic from print and/or digital sources.

BFDCF296CBD343B18FB12D07DD65D45B.description: Gather information (e.g., highlight in text, quote, or paraphrase from text) from print and/or digital sources.

8F3AB08AF9E44739BD366A6589E63FE1.description:
Gather relevant information (e.g., highlight in text, quote, or paraphrase from text or discussion) from print and/or digital
sources.

5A1DEF29F60246738885B5533B1DCEB0.description: Recall relevant information from experiences for use in writing.

F62030FD932947C0B21AEA2D0435A559.description: Recall relevant information from experiences for use in writing.

A8EB97903ACF4E40A8B9CB37FAF5D5BE.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and digital sources; take notes, categorize information,
and provide a list of sources.

423AAE3B803D4399838EDCDC5492BC45.description:
Follow steps to complete a short research project (e.g., determine topic, locating information on a topic, organizing information
related to the topic, drafting a permanent product).

1F6DEFB837284C9583EEE75B7EC4D1FF.description: Conduct short research projects that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic.

DF0B459A368448AEA697441930875C96.description:
With guidance and support from adults, use technology to produce and publish writing (e.g., use internet to gather information;
use word processing to generate and collaborate on writing).

DBBF6C8C22DD46CEA024E0EE049F2003.description:
With some guidance and support from adults, use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing as well as to interact and
collaborate with others; demonstrate sufficient command of keyboarding skills to complete a writing task.

20D1EE5CAC0B4E8EAA54B1F9031DADAE.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit writing for clarity and meaning.

0FFCCA21BC6C43729E946D1F5CA55A65.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit narrative writing for clarity and meaning.

909E71A613E14EA0A3B02376CE9E376D.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, edit writing for clarity and meaning.

EC139782C5F946EABE323B88F18CA8BD.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising and editing.

6180849948CD4EB4B150BB1B0B8EC3D7.description:
Draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task, purpose, and audience (e.g., define
purpose, which is to persuade, state your opinion, gather evidence, create your argument, and provide a meaningful conclusion).

06C78AEC6D4D49CBA587053193C0BBEF.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising.

FF5D7A93AE5649D8A9598B9B5402DA95.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, strengthen writing by revising (e.g., review product, strengthening story).

69BF17D1B55042ACA1A21E3ECE21F27B.description:
Draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task and purpose (e.g., determine the topic,
gather information, develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

9CFA52473B49444E92EB1762475FE11F.description:
Draft an outline in which the development and organization are appropriate to the task and purpose (e.g., to introduce real or
imagined experiences or events, elaborate on experiences or events with details and techniques, provide a meaningful conclusion).

A1DF295388214EE3981C5EBE76E1881D.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing (e.g., determine the topic, gather information,
develop the topic, provide a meaningful conclusion).

510A23EE34A54BFB8974C01E9C13E2BB.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing based on a literary topic (e.g., select a topic,
draft outline, develop narrative).

6625DCA6CE154B67AAAD7F870D161C0A.description: With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop a plan for writing.

908E8CAC8AB740E9BB34CE8A1997EB57.description:
With guidance and support from peers and adults, develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, revising, and editing. (Editing for
conventions should demonstrate command of Language standards 1–3 up to and including grade 4).

70E2E4BCFEA04D14B9373C1318FEF62C.description: Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose, and audience.

EC50C4C8F3D94B1DA27DF57FC53490DE.description:
Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose (e.g., to entertain), and
audience.

148765E9664740C1BAFE9DD3F6A6AC94.description: Produce a clear coherent permanent product that is appropriate to the specific task, purpose, and audience.

D9636BAEBDD149F0A1885D7340DB6626.description:
Produce clear and coherent writing in which the development and organization are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience. (Grade-specific
expectations for writing types are defined in standards 1–3 above).

1A2896D7816D40FB9C323EBD67A02996.description:
Provide a conclusion (concluding sentence, paragraph, or extended ending) that follows from the narrated experiences or
events.

53DECF0009554624AA7E3F90504C5728.description: Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events.

E274A217DF1E40B6BC0EBEF247B7BFE9.description: Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.

9FE0EEF70DCF45858CE4F96B5BE4488D.description:
When appropriate, use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to
situations.

DC7259A6202A435E81CB33B9E8094F5A.description: Sequence events in writing that unfold naturally.

17DD88B6E4E740B18FA4A29152D6A9A2.description: Orient the reader by setting up the context for the story and introducing a narrator and/or characters.

3E960BD890534B5694EF75F2511D18A3.description:
Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, descriptive details, and clear event sequences.
a. Orient the reader by establishing a situation and introducing a narrator and/or characters; organize an event sequence that unfolds
naturally.
b. Use dialogue and description to develop experiences and events or show the responses of characters to situations.
c. Use a variety of transitional words and phrases to manage the sequence of events.
d. Use concrete words and phrases and sensory details to convey experiences and events precisely.
e. Provide a conclusion that follows from the narrated experiences or events.

5A4E6C8183E740E49CE921DC5D77AA3B.description: Provide a concluding statement or section to support the information presented.

8522C16BD7994FAEA889070F2AE972A1.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

55563DBAADEC41308C0EB446FECA1D0A.description: Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).

5B43D343525F43C5B2D1790E1C565463.description: Include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and multimedia when appropriate to convey information about the topic.

8BDCF75446154461A177C1599DC13361.description:
Develop the topic (add additional information related to the topic) with relevant facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations,
or other information and examples related to the topic.

2468CA40AE6A4206914EF8C6408A8B72.description: Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections.

5C53AE19542741219007D6F049694D4C.description:
Write informative/explanatory texts to examine a topic and convey ideas and information clearly.
a. Introduce a topic clearly and group related information in paragraphs and sections; include formatting (e.g., headings), illustrations, and
multimedia when useful to aiding comprehension.
b. Develop the topic with facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples related to the topic.
c. Link ideas within categories of information using words and phrases (e.g., another, for example, also, because).
d. Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.
e. Provide a concluding statement or section related to the information or explanation presented.

7AD0BCFFC26E4478819762B9D0847B44.description: Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

6355FBFCE4DB426F91CD42879D5DC1EB.description: Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).

654679FF5AD5474CBF40DA31E884EAB0.description: Create an organizational structure that lists reasons in a logical order.

B470671BEF094B819106CA73FA0536A3.description: Provide reasons which include facts and details that support a stated opinion.

4739B2FE6F544E7F8057FF15A64424B0.description: Introduce the topic or text within persuasive writing by stating an opinion.

07FFD5BC4E3F4C4198004895E9A28DEB.description:
Write opinion pieces on topics or texts, supporting a point of view with reasons and information.
a. Introduce a topic or text clearly, state an opinion, and create an organizational structure in which related ideas are grouped to support the
writer’s purpose.
b. Provide reasons that are supported by facts and details.
c. Link opinion and reasons using words and phrases (e.g., for instance, in order to, in addition).
d. Provide a concluding statement or section related to the opinion presented.

DB0C74D14D7E4B0BBA39ECA50F5C9698.description: Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition.

80DAE8B0CB334C9F8A45B2A5F89FC8A5.description:
Practice self-monitoring strategies to aid comprehension (e.g., reread, use visuals or cueing system, self-correct, ask
questions, confirm predictions).

BEC596A5BCEB4CDE9A49B38F64E09605.description:
Read text (including prose and poetry) with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression (when applicable) on successive
readings.

83FFC61DB9144C48A652A7A43E4A01A3.description:
Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.
a. Read grade-level text with purpose and understanding.
b. Read grade-level prose and poetry orally with accuracy, appropriate rate, and expression on successive readings.
c. Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as necessary.

0E7E78C9B78F4133BEB27F00335CB21C.description: Recognize and/or read grade appropriate irregularly spelled words.

ABFEF48A7421428DAA3101DFDE46802E.description: Identify grade level words with accuracy and on successive attempts.

0D78316F03AE4EC794777F0C9ABC9D59.description:
Use letter-sound correspondences, syllabication patterns, and morphology (e.g., affixes) to identify and/or read
multisyllabic words.

39FD2E2E22D1405AA291B7B075644265.description:
Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills in decoding multisyllabic words in context and out of context.
a. Use combined knowledge of all letter-sound correspondences to read unfamiliar multisyllabic words accurately.
b. Apply knowledge of the six syllable patterns to read grade level words accurately.
c. Use combined knowledge of morphology (e.g., roots and affixes) to read grade level words accurately.

17578CCB4F4E4BECABFE55348BDE0103.description: Read or be read to and recount self-selected stories, dramas, poetry and other types of text.

46C0EB053C9D4E22A33F0189DF4FF0A0.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend informational texts, including history/social studies, science, and
technical texts, in a text complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 4.

D7BBBCB80B034679BA2DCF8B05CDF6D4.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

E22CAF3E45E14CA596AD0A393B9B0130.description:
Identify the most important information about a topic gathered from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak
about the subject knowledgeably.

A34DCCF3B7814C6A978EC64AD8D582F1.description: Report out about two or more texts on the same self-selected topic.

5E89F28A80624F15B352DF2AB193DF6D.description: Integrate information from two texts on the same topic in order to write or speak about the subject knowledgeably.

4611FF69162540DAB90A683BFA4BD9E8.description: Identify facts that an author uses to support a specific point or opinion.

36BC2FD264D64E32941E6A7CD72DE459.description: 5 Identify reasons that the author uses to support ideas in an informational text.

F569051F45F548D7B0C2A60821104061.description: Compare and contrast how different authors use reasons and evidence to support the same topics across texts.

9477B91CBCCB499A9A3E4EB92A7B3FEF.description: Explain how an author uses reasons and evidence to support particular points in a text.

38817237A80A4551B917E0C2469AFB44.description: Use illustrations (e.g., maps, photographs, diagrams, timelines) in informational texts to answer questions.

50D47E0E660D4D3E8B76B5A55350FC89.description:
Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or
interactive elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

8EF819F459C14BCF9EA63B70F7F671FB.description:
Explain how the information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively contributes to the understanding of the text in which it
appears.

9E54C215BE204D14AFD9200882C53341.description:
Use information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or
interactive elements on Web pages) to answer questions.

4A15ABF16CBF438B829E71A41814069B.description:
Interpret information presented visually, orally, or quantitatively (e.g., in charts, graphs, diagrams, time lines, animations, or interactive
elements on Web pages) and explain how the information contributes to an understanding of the text in which it appears.

1E8AC1AEAA6746C580715A490E33C54F.description: Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic.

DAAEF7ECFABC458DA276C9788E588DE7.description: Determine if information in a text is firsthand or secondhand.

9E7F567E4E3D45CEBEDDB4511AD20B80.description:
Compare and contrast a firsthand and secondhand account of the same event or topic; describe the differences in focus, and the information
provided.

2DB9BEB0867C4607805B8824797E3A71.description: Use tools (e.g., sidebars, icons, glossary) to locate information relevant to a given topic.

32FE4F9377CE4E5B8D53B570503033C4.description: Use text features(keywords, glossary) to locate information relevant to a given topic or question.

175DDF0F67D4454FADF5BDBBDA0BE5AC.description: Organize information presented in an informational text to demonstrate the text structure.

CF302A37B3814B9AA38561AC1FFE89AD.description:
Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or
information in a text or part of a text.

484928100AD84F338AA90DAFA16BF7A0.description:
Identify signal words that help determine what the text structure is in an informational text (e.g., description, problem/solution,
time/order, compare/contrast, cause/effect, directions.

43FE77DF11FF4EE9A82D563F2BFAB7DC.description:
Describe the overall structure (e.g., chronology, comparison, cause/effect, and problem/solution) of events, ideas, concepts, or information in
a text or part of a text.

40084499D4104A22A242F04343CFC559.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or
subject area.

2BFC9AFC8BAD4CFBAB7F15A6A58C2177.description: Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words or phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or subject area.

BA87BDC241B0453A94335353E9972140.description: No CCCs developed for this standard.

F40A8C2E8A4F49DCB64FB20431EDE7CC.description:
Explain events, procedures, ideas, or concepts in a historical, scientific, or technical text, including what happened and why, based on specific
information in the text.

A557B05894AD4EC3872746D62F98472B.description: Identify supporting details of an informational text.

48E493CBB12E466A837A05D3CFFEBAA0.description: Determine the main idea of an informational text.

E3F1F39767DB4B87A0EEE9B76F8ECFBF.description: Determine the main idea of a text and explain how it is supported by key details; summarize the text.

4B737E4945BD4E5C98EB13AA7A2C324A.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when drawing basic inferences from an informational text.

2CDD39FA1D3846A2B3003F5A581080C6.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

2161B7CAD9EE46BABC59CD0385A8415F.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.

5B03E3F763924F179A361A689FAC7BCF.description: Read or be read to and recount self-selected stories, dramas, poetry and other types of text and adapted text.

41B9E76FDFBE4ADFAF43E6E2CBF44279.description:
By the end of the year, proficiently and independently read and comprehend literature, including stories, dramas, and poetry, in a text
complexity range determined by qualitative and quantitative measures appropriate to grade 4.

2DEED6CFD39A4282A4FE255822C86CEB.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

8B41E1717E974CB59AB529EB96CEB8AC.description:
Compare the treatment of patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in stories, myths, and traditional literature from different
cultures.

8632E474F5564DD49C2F8B517281577A.description:
Compare the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) in stories myths, and traditional
literature from different cultures.

B44362306DF74864820A69E91F3F4A20.description:
Compare and contrast the treatment of similar themes and topics (e.g., opposition of good and evil) and patterns of events (e.g., the quest) in
stories, myths, and traditional literature from different cultures.

ADE47F379DF2482D97C651D5261E49C5.description: Make connections between the text of a play and the oral representations, refer back to text/illustrations to support answer.

689EDCD4B8904ABF8380E9D8AE99AA1D.description:
Make connections between the text of a story and the visual representations, refer back to text/illustrations to support
answer.

7BBA59DBB4F74591BF09C4657B0173A4.description:
Use evidence from both the text version and oral or visual presentation of the same text to support inferences, opinions, and
conclusions.

676B6C0C69BD4C3DB862DBB28848582F.description:
Make connections between the text of a story or drama and a visual or oral presentation of the text, identifying where each version reflects
specific descriptions and directions in the text.

A3A6C26D402C4F9698ABB8AEBEAA1124.description:
Compare the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first- and third-person
narrations.

DED90EAF97E046A597BFE4904BFB39D2.description: Determine the author's point of view (first- or third- person).

DC87274EECF64881AF25FC1BED9DFD24.description:
Compare and contrast the point of view from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first-and third-person
narrations.

623BA22CB38D48848B5C0031250278B8.description:
Identify how the structure of a play is different than the structure of a story (e.g., text includes props; dialogue without
quotation marks acts/scenes instead of chapter).

B591D8B8C95A4291B4DE9068C1E2979C.description:
Identify how the structure of a poem is different than a story (e.g., identify rhyme, shorter than stories; stanza instead of
paragraph).

585AC1FC76244BD1A5C22BDE78C9B3DE.description: Explain the overall structure and major differences between poetry, drama, and prose.

A905F00DB2254B22B690F2A69B2D853E.description:
Determine the meaning of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases in a text relevant to a grade 4 topic or
subject area.

621418A1B75D4400A3E964B7F7562BC3.description:
Determine the meaning of words, phrases, and figurative language found in stories, poetry, myths, and traditional literature from different
cultures, including those that allude to significant characters.

70A46CC7E97B4B6094031B8D021FD4FE.description: Describe character motivation (e.g., actions, thoughts, words); use details from text to support description.

66D7EDFD50464011B17110439C84232A.description:
Describe character traits (e.g., actions, deeds, dialogue, description, motivation, interactions); use details from text to support
description.

A4C9B4BE6EC14AACBDA5BA05FF23CE65.description:
Answer questions related to the relationship between characters, setting, events, or conflicts (e.g., characters and events,
characters and conflicts, setting and conflicts).

38CF12EB6D1C45B184363811BF898F25.description:
Describe in depth a character, setting, or event in a story or drama, drawing on specific details in the text (e.g., a character’s thoughts, words,
or actions).

BDB4E8685E084DCA828D4E9F91EFC618.description: Determine the theme of a story, drama, or poem; refer to text to support answer.

A68846D802A640FBB241B2E7E49CB696.description: Use evidence from the text to summarize a story, poem or drama

C8C3DD4BB5AC447BB7DCBBFE7CBE16F1.description: Determine a theme of a story, drama, or poem from details in the text; summarize the text.

F6D8571C87C443489C3480D658ED0046.description:
Use details and examples in a text when explaining the author's purpose (e.g., what did the author use to scare you, surprise
you?).

4D2FEC7387FA478B82ADEC1664E82947.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when drawing basic inferences about a story, poem, or drama.

70190265AEC2412CAD8092F6BCAFAC96.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly.

23B85BB6D26648B18975923C832A5B71.description: Refer to details and examples in a text when explaining what the text says explicitly and when drawing inferences from the text.
